properties.doc:
Core Context Properties =======================
This is the list of the core contextual properties of the Maemo platform.
This document is maintained as part of the +contextkit+ package. Please report change requests as bugs against the +contextkit+ package.
*NOTE:* Most of these properties are unstable and their definition will change for some time still. Only the ones explicitly marked as stable should be used for now.

node.name: Screen
node.doc:
Display screens ---------------
These properties talk about the display screens of the device.

key.name: TopEdge
key.doc: The edge of the main display screen where the user expects the top-most UI elements to be. Possible values are the strings "top", "bottom", "left", and "right", which refer to the edges of the screen in its normal orientation as defined by the graphics hardware. _(stable)_

key.name: IsCovered
key.doc: Whether or not the main display screen is covered and can thus not be seen by the user. This might mean that the device is laying face down on a table, or that its lid is closed if it has one. _(stable)_

node.name: Location
node.doc:
Location --------
Information about the geographic location of the device.

key.name: Streets
key.doc: The names of the nearby streets, as a set of strings. The set might be empty when the current location is not near any street, or there might be more than one name in the list when we are at an intersection.

key.name: City
key.doc: The localized name of the current city, as a string.

key.name: State
key.doc: The localized name of the current state, as a string.

key.name: StateCode
key.doc: The ISO 3166-2 code of the current state, as a string. See link:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2[here] for more information. The value of this property includes the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 prefix, as is usual for ISO 3166-2 codes.

key.name: Country
key.doc: The localized name of the current country, as a string.

key.name: CountryCode
key.doc: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the current country, as a string. See link:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1[here] for more information.

key.name: Continent
key.doc: The localized name of the current continent, as a string.

key.name: Planet
key.doc: The localized name of the current planet (or dwarf planet), as a string.

node.name: Connectivity
node.doc:
Network connectivity --------------------
Information about the network connectivity of the device.

node.name: Environment
node.doc:
Environment -----------
Information about the environment the device is in.

key.name: IsDark
key.doc: Whether or not it is dark.

key.name: SunRise
key.doc: The time of sun rise.

key.name: SunSet
key.doc: The time of sun set.

node.name: Weather
node.doc:
Weather ~~~~~~~
The current weather. (Right now, it's a set of properties, but we might unify this as a single property with a big dictionary as its value. Or not.) See http://www.ominous-valve.com/wx_codes.txt for more information about codifying weather conditions. We should lift something from there, if just for extra geek points.

key.name: Condition
key.doc: The current weather condition, as a localized, human readable string. Examples are "Cloudy", "Raining", etc.

key.name: ConditionCode
key.doc: The current weather condition, as a symbolic string. The set of symbols is to be defined, but it will be fixed and quite small so that you can provide an icon for each of them, etc.

key.name: Humidity
key.doc: The relative humidity in percent.

key.name: Temperature
key.doc: The temperature as a localized string. This string represents the temperature in the way preferred by the user. Most often this means either degrees Celsius or degrees Fahrenheit, but it could be some other unit entirely.

key.name: TemperatureK
key.doc: The temperature in Kelvin.

key.name: FeltTemperature
key.doc: The felt temperature as a localized string, analogous to Temperature.

key.name: FeltTemperatureK
key.doc: The felt temperature in Kelvin.

key.name: DewPoint
key.doc: The dew point as a localized string, analogous to Temperature.

key.name: DewPointK
key.doc: The dew point in Kelvin.

key.name: Pressure
key.doc: The atmospheric pressure in milli bar.

key.name: Precipitation
key.doc: The rain or snow fall in millimeter per square meter per hour (or some other more common unit).

key.name: Visibility
key.doc: The visibility in meter.

key.name: WindSpeed
key.doc: The wind speed in meters per second.

key.name: WindDirection
key.doc: The wind direction as a localized string. The direction is given in compass terms: North, South-West, etc.

key.name: WindDirectionD
key.doc: The wind direction in degrees. North is 0, east is 90, etc.
